page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: It is a country scene with scattered houses mainly cottages and buildings made of local stone and three moorland villages.Of these villages{Mount {Warleggan}and{Cardinham,}Mount is the largest and has a post office,shop and village hall. The ground slopes towards the{River {Fowey}in the south.There are five valleys all with streams and four are richly wooded with deciduous trees and planted conifers.On the higher ground the moor offers rough grazing to cattle and ponies with outcrops of weathered granite. The roads are built on the high ground and mostly have high hedgerows with an abundance of wild flowers.There are many footpaths and bridleways mainly used for pleasure.The area is{sparsely {populated,with few amenities. }
